0: Loyal to the end: Heart-breaking photo shows Navy SEAL's devoted dog guarding his coffin NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Petty Officer Jon Tumilson killed in Afghanistan crash NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Navy SEAL was one of 38 shot down in helicopter NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Labrador retriever Hawkeye was at emotional service NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR This heart-wrenching photo shows how a Navy SEAL’s dog refused to leave his master’s side during an emotional funeral. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Petty Officer Jon Tumilson, 35, killed in the major U.S. helicopter crash in Afghanistan this month, was remembered by around 1,500 mourners. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR But it was his Labrador retriever Hawkeye that really captured the public’s emotions in the photo taken by Mr Tumilson’s cousin, Lisa Pembleton. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Scroll down for video NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Sadness: Navy SEAL Jon Tumilson's Labrador retriever Hawkeye was loyal to the end, as he refused to leave his master's side during an emotional funeral NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Man's best friend: Mr Tumilson's family members followed Hawkeye into the service before he lay down NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Mr Tumilson, of San Diego, California, was one of 38 killed on August 6 when a rocket-propelled grenade took out a U.S. Chinook helicopter. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR WHAT WILL HAPPEN TO HAWKEYE? Nikki Virgilio, a friend of Mr Tumilson (known as J.T.) who was at the funeral, said Hawkeye was a personal pet rather than a military dog. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR 'I can happily report to you that Hawkeye was willed to one of J.T.'s good friends, the same one that took care of him whenever J.T. was deployed overseas,' she wrote on Facebook. This close friend was revealed by the Des Moines Register to be Scott Nichols. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR His funeral was held on Friday in his hometown of Rockford, Iowa, at the Rudd-Rockford-Marble Rock Community School. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Ms Pembleton said: ‘I felt compelled to take one photo to share with family members that couldn't make it or couldn't see what I could from the aisle. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR 'To say that he was an amazing man doesn't do him justice. The loss of Jon to his family, military family and friends is immeasurable.' NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Hawkeye's new owner was revealed by the Des Moines Register to be Mr Tumilson's close friend Scott Nichols, who said at the funeral that the fallen SEAL was more scared of his parents dying than being killed himself. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Big funeral: Petty Officer Jon Tumilson, 35, killed in the Afghanistan helicopter crash this month, was remembered by around 1,500 mourners Pride: Mr Tumilson's mother and father were told they helped raise an 'outstanding man - a hero' NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Mr Tumilson's friend Nikki Virgilio wrote on Facebook that Hawkeye's new owner had previously taken care of the dog while his owner was delployed abroad. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR ‘I felt compelled to take one photo to share with family members that couldn't make it or couldn't see what I could from the aisle' NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Lisa Pembleton, cousin NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR During the service, U.S. Navy Lieutenant Robert Bradshaw told Mr Tumilson's parents that they helped raise an ‘outstanding man - a hero’. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Family, friends and servicemen, along with Iowa Governor Terry Branstad and U.S. Senator Charles Grassley, packed the school's gymnasium. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Mr Tumilson, who joined the Navy in 1995, was known to friends as J.T. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR ‘J.T. was going to be a Navy SEAL come hell or high water,’ friend Scott Nichols said. ‘He wasn't afraid of dying.’ NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Packed: His funeral was held in his hometown of Rockford, Iowa, at the Rudd-Rockford-Marble Rock Community School NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Downed: Mr Tumilson, of San Diego, California, was one of 38 killed on August 6 when a rocket-propelled grenade took out their Chinook helicopter NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR ‘If J.T. had known he was going to be shot down when going to the aid of others, he would have went anyway,’ friend and soldier Boe Nankivel said. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR ‘If J.T. had known he was going to be shot down when going to the aid of others, he would have went anyway' NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Boe Nankivel, friend and fellow soldier NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Mr Tumilson's sister, Kristie Pohlman, said he always dreamed of joining the military's elite special forces unit. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR ‘Your dreams were big and seemed impossible to nearly everyone on the outside,’ she said. ‘I always knew you'd somehow do what you wanted.’ NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Family members followed Hawkeye into the service. Mr Tumilson is survived by two sisters and his parents, George and Kathleen.
